intro: Dianthus chinensis var. versicolor, commonly known as the Chinese carnation, is a flowering plant native to China. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, red, white, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers bloom in spring and summer, adding vibrant color to gardens throughout the growing season.
